issuetype.description: A problem which impairs or prevents the functions of the product.
issuetype.name: Bug

projectCategory.description: Titanium and related SDKs used in application development
projectCategory.name: Client

status.description: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are closed can be reopened.
status.name: Closed

fields.description:
h5. Description

In 3.4.0.GA the tiapp.xml tags for iOS were changed, the old way was using <iPhone> and now <iOS> has taken it's place. The orientation options need to be merged into the <iOS> tag as that is the new standard.

The tag should be:

{code}
<ios>
     <plist>
            <dict>
                <key>UISupportedInterfaceOrientations~iphone</key>
                <array>
                    <string>UIInterfaceOrientationPortrait</string>
                </array>
                <key>UISupportedInterfaceOrientations~ipad</key>
                <array>
                    <string>UIInterfaceOrientationPortrait</string>
                    <string>UIInterfaceOrientationPortraitUpsideDown</string>
                    <string>UIInterfaceOrientationLandscapeLeft</string>
                    <string>UIInterfaceOrientationLandscapeRight</string>
                </array>
                <key>NSLocationWhenInUseUsageDescription</key>
                <string>
                Specify the reason for accessing the userâ€™s location information.
                This appears in the alert dialog when asking the user for permission to access their location.
                </string>                
            </dict>
        </plist>
    </ios>
{code}
fields.summary: KitchenSink: <iPhone> and <iOS> tags both exist in KS tiapp.xml, only <iOS> should be used
fields.environment:
Mac OSX 10.10 (Yosemite)
Appcelerator Studio, build:  3.4.0.201409261245
Titanium SDK, build: 3.4.0.GA
Titanium CLI, build: 3.4.0
Alloy, build: 1.5.1
KitchenSink: 3.4.0

comments.body: Resolving ticket as Invalid as there is now a new version of Kitchen Sink available and we no longer support the version which relates to this ticket.
